a.g: Certainly has Allah heard the speech of the one who argues with you, [O Muhammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to Allah. And Allah hears your dialogue; indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

Those who pronounce thihar among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.

And those who pronounce thihar from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to believe [completely] in Allah and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] Allah. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allah had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and Allah is, over all things, Witness.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى يوم يبعثهم الله جميعا فينبئهم بما عملوا أحصاه الله ونسوه والله على كل شىء شهيد فعرف أرباب البصائر من جملة العباد أن الله تعالى لهم بالمرصاد وأنهم سيناقشون في الحساب ويطالبون بمثاقيل الذر من الخطرات واللحظات وتحققوا أنه لا ينجيهم من هذه الأخطار إلا لزوم المحاسبة وصدق المراقبة ومطالبة النفس في الأنفاس والحركات ومحاسبتها في الخطرات واللحظات فمن حاسب نفسه قبل أن يحاسب خف في القيامة حسابه وحضر عند السؤال جوابه وحسن منقلبه ومآبه ومن لم يحاسب نفسه دامت حسراته وطالت في عرصات القيامة وقفاته وقادته إلى الخزى والمقت سيئاته فلما انكشف لهم ذلك علموا أنه لا ينجيهم منه إلا طاعة الله وقد أمرهم بالصبر والمرابطة.
Indeed, God Almighty says: "On the Day when God will resurrect them all together, then He will inform them of what they did. God has kept account of it, while they have forgotten it; and God is Witness over all things." (58:6) Thus, the possessors of insight [arbab al-basa'ir] from among the servants recognized that God Almighty lies in wait for them, and that they will be scrutinized in the Reckoning [hisab] and held accountable for the weight of an atom [mithqal al-dharr] from their passing thoughts [khawatir] and glances [lahazat]. They became certain [tahaqqu] that nothing will save them from these perils except adhering to self-reckoning [muhasaba] and sincere self-watchfulness [muraqaba], and holding the soul [nafs] to account for every breath [anfas] and movement [harakat], and reckoning with it for every passing thought [khawatir] and glance [lahazat]. For whoever holds his soul to account before he is held to account, his reckoning on the Day of Standing [al-qiyamah] will be lightened, his answer will be present when questioned, and his return [ma'ab] and outcome [manqalib] will be good. And whoever does not hold his soul to account, his regrets [hasrat] will be prolonged, his halts in the plains of the Resurrection [arassat al-qiyamah] will be extended, and his misdeeds [sayyi'at] will lead him to disgrace and contempt. When this was unveiled [inkashafa] to them, they knew that nothing would save them from it except obedience to God, and He has commanded them with patience [sabr] and vigilant steadfastness [murabata].

a.g: Have you not considered that Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth? There is in no private conversation three but that He is the fourth of them, nor are there five but that He is the sixth of them - and no less than that and no more except that He is with them [in knowledge] wherever they are. Then He will inform them of what they did, on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, of all things, Knowing.

Have you not considered those who were forbidden from private conversation, then they return to that which they were forbidden and converse among themselves about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you with that [word] by which Allah does not greet you and say among themselves, "Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?" Sufficient for them is Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the destination.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال الله تعالى جواباً لقولهم "حسبهم جهنم يصلونها فبئس المصير" ومرة ينظرون إلى المؤمنين؛ وهم فقراء شعث غبر فيزدرون بهم ويستحقرونهم، فيقولون "أهؤلاء من الله عليهم من بيننا" ويقولون "لو كان خيراً ما سبقونا إليه" وترتيب القياس الذي نظمه في قلوبهم أنهم يقولون: قد أحسن الله إلينا بنعيم الدنيا، وكل محسن فهو محب، وكل محب فإنه يحسن أيضاً في المستقبل كما قال الشاعر: |لقد أحسن الله | |كذلك يحسن فيما| |فيما مضى | |بقـي | وإنما يقيس المستقبل على الماضي بواسطة الكرامة والحب إذ يقول: لولا أني كريم عند الله ومحبوب لما أحسن إلي. والتلبيس تحت ظنه أن كل محسن محب، لا بل تحت ظنه أن إنعامه عليه في الدنيا إحسان، فقد اغتر بالله إذ ظن أنه كريم عنده بدليل لا يدل على الكرامة بل عند ذوي البصائر يدل على الهوان.
Indeed, God the Exalted answered their statement, "Hell is sufficient for them; they will enter it, and wretched is the destination." And at times they look upon the believers—who are poor, disheveled, and dusty—and they scorn them and belittle them, saying, "Are these the ones whom God has favored among us?" and they say, "If it were any good, they would not have preceded us to it." And the structure of the syllogism [qiyas] they have arranged in their hearts [qulub] is that they say: God has been good to us with the comfort of the world [dunya], and every benefactor is a lover, and every lover will also be good in the future, as the poet said: 'God has been good in what has passed, and thus He will be good in what remains.' And they only analogize the future to the past based on honor [karamah] and love, for they say: Were I not honorable and beloved to God, He would not have been good to me. The deception [talbis] lies beneath their assumption that every benefactor is a lover; nay, beneath their assumption that His bestowing upon them in the world [dunya] is a benefaction. Thus, they are deluded concerning God, for they suppose they are honorable to Him based on evidence that does not indicate honor [karamah]; rather, in the sight of those of insight [basirah], it indicates disgrace.

a.g: O you who have believed, when you converse privately, do not converse about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger but converse about righteousness and piety. And fear Allah, to whom you will be gathered.
Private conversation is only from Satan that he may grieve those who have believed, but he will not harm them at all except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.

O you who have believed, when you are told, "Space yourselves" in assemblies, then make space; Allah will make space for you. And when you are told, "Arise," then arise; Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
يَرْفَعُ اللَّهُ الْعَالِمَ فَوْقَ الْمُؤْمِنِ بِسَبْعِمِائَةِ دَرَجَةٍ بَيْنَ كُلِّ دَرَجَتَيْنِ كَمَا بَيْنَ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ. وَإِنَّمَا مَرَادُ الطَّاعَاتِ وَأَعْمَالِ الْجَوَارِحِ كُلِّهَا تَصْفِيَةُ الْقَلْبِ وَتَزْكِيَتُهُ وَجَلَاؤُهُ قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ زَكَّاهَا وَمَرَادُ تَزْكِيَتِهِ حُصُولُ أَنْوَارِ الْإِيمَانِ فِيهِ أَعْنِي إِشْرَاقَ نُورِ الْمَعْرِفَةِ وَهُوَ الْمُرَادُ بِقَوْلِهِ تَعَالَى فَمَنْ يُرِدِ اللَّهُ أَنْ يَهْدِيَهُ يَشْرَحْ صَدْرَهُ لِلْإِسْلَامِ أَفَمَنْ شَرَحَ اللَّهُ صَدْرَهُ لِلْإِسْلَامِ فَهُوَ عَلَى نُورٍ مِنْ رَبِّهِ نَعَمْ هَذَا التَّجَلِّي وَهَذَا الْإِيمَانُ لَهُ ثَلَاثُ مَرَاتِبَ الْمَرْتَبَةُ الْأُولَى إِيمَانُ الْعَوَامِ وَهُوَ إِيمَانُ التَّقْلِيدِ الْمَحْضِ وَالثَّانِيَةُ إِيمَانُ الْمُتَكَلِّمِينَ وَهُوَ مَمْزُوجٌ بِنَوْعِ اسْتِدْلَالٍ وَدَرَجَتُهُ قَرِيبَةٌ مِنْ دَرَجَةِ إِيمَانِ الْعَوَامِ وَالثَّالِثَةُ إِيمَانُ الْعَارِفِينَ وَهُوَ الْمُشَاهَدُ بِنُورِ الْيَقِينِ. وَهُمْ أَيْضًا يَتَفَاوَتُونَ بِمَقَادِيرِ الْعُلُومِ وَبِدَرَجَاتِ الْكَشْفِ أَمَّا دَرَجَاتُ الْكَشْفِ فَمِثَالُهُ أَنْ يُبْصِرَ زَيْدًا فِي الدَّارِ عَنْ قُرْبٍ وَفِي صَحْنِ الدَّارِ فِي وَقْتِ إِشْرَاقِ الشَّمْسِ فَيُكْمَلُ لَهُ إِدْرَاكُهُ وَالْآخَرُ يُدْرِكُهُ فِي بَيْتٍ أَوْ مِنْ بَعْدٍ أَوْ فِي وَقْتِ عَشِيَّةٍ فَيَتَمَثَّلُ لَهُ فِي صُورَتِهِ مَا يَسْتَيْقِنُ مَعَهُ أَنَّهُ هُوَ وَلَكِنْ لَا يَتَمَثَّلُ فِي نَفْسِهِ الدَّقَائِقَ وَالْخَفَايَا مِنْ صُورَتِهِ وَمِثْلُ هَذَا مُتَصَوَّرٌ فِي تَفَاوُتِ الْمُشَاهَدَةِ لِلْأُمُورِ الْإِلَهِيَّةِ وَأَمَّا مَقَادِيرُ الْعُلُومِ فَهُوَ بِأَنْ يَرَى فِي الدَّارِ زَيْدًا وَعَمْرًا وَبَكْرًا غَيْرَ ذَلِكَ وَآخَرُ لَا يَرَى إِلَّا زَيْدًا فَمَعْرِفَةُ ذَلِكَ تَزِيدُ بِكَثْرَةِ الْمَعْلُومَاتِ لَا مَحَالَةَ فَهَذَا حَالُ الْقَلْبِ بِالْإِضَافَةِ إِلَى الْعُلُومِ.
Indeed, Allah raises the scholar [al-'alim] above the believer by seven hundred degrees, and between every two degrees is as the distance between the heavens and the earth. And indeed, the purpose of all acts of obedience [ta'at] and the works of the limbs is the purification [tasfiya] of the heart [qalb], its refinement [tazkiya], and its polishing. "He has succeeded who purifies it." And the purpose of its refinement is the attainment of the lights of faith [anwar al-iman] within it—I mean the shining forth of the light of knowledge [nur al-ma'rifa]. And this is what is intended by His, the Exalted's, saying: "So whoever Allah wills to guide, He expands his breast to Islam. Is he whose breast Allah has expanded to Islam, then he is upon a light from his Lord?" Yes, this manifestation [tajalli] and this faith [iman] have three levels. The first level is the faith of the common people [iman al-'awamm], and it is the faith of pure imitation [taqlid]. The second is the faith of the theologians [iman al-mutakallimin], and it is mixed with a kind of rational deduction [istidlal], and its degree is close to the degree of the faith of the common people. The third is the faith of the knowers [iman al-'arifin], and it is what is witnessed [mushahad] by the light of certainty [nur al-yaqin]. And they also differ according to the measures of knowledge [maqadir al-'ulum] and the degrees of unveiling [darajat al-kashf]. As for the degrees of unveiling, its example is that one sees Zayd in the courtyard from nearby and in the open courtyard at the time of the sun's shining, so his perception of him is complete. Another perceives him in a room, or from a distance, or at the time of dusk, so he appears to him in his form such that he is certain [yastayqinu] it is him, but the subtleties [daqaiq] and hidden aspects [khafaya] of his form do not appear to his inner self [nafs]. And the like of this is conceivable in the disparity of witnessing [mushahada] divine matters. As for the measures of knowledge, it is that one sees in the courtyard Zayd, 'Amr, and Bakr, and another besides that, while another sees only Zayd. So the knowledge [ma'rifa] of that increases with the abundance of known things [ma'lumat], inevitably. This is the state of the heart [qalb] in relation to the sciences [al-'ulum].

a.g: O you who have believed, when you [wish to] privately consult the Messenger, present before your consultation a charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

Have you feared to present before your consultation charities? Then when you do not and Allah has forgiven you, then [at least] establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
Have you not considered those who make allies of a people with whom Allah has become angry? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to untruth while they know [they are lying].
Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
They took their [false] oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah, and for them is a humiliating punishment.
Never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally
On the Day Allah will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they are [standing] on something. Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.
Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they will be the losers.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولتضادهما قال الله تعالى استحوذ عليهم الشيطان فأنساهم ذكر الله ولا يمحو وسوسة الشيطان من القلب إلا ذكر ما سوى ما يوسوس به لأنه إذا خطر في القلب ذكر شيء انعدم منه ما كان فيه من قبل ولكن كل شيء سوى الله تعالى وسوى ما يتعلق به فيجوز أيضا أن يكون مجالا للشيطان وذكر الله هو الذي يؤمن جانبه ويعلم أنه ليس للشيطان فيه مجال ولا يعالج الشيء إلا بضده وضد جميع وساوس الشيطان ذكر الله بالاستعاذة والتبري عن الحول والقوة وهو معنى قولك أعوذ بالله من الشيطان الرجيم ولا حول ولا قوة إلا بالله العلي العظيم وذلك لا يقدر عليه إلا المتقون الغالب عليهم ذكر الله تعالى وإنما الشيطان يطوف عليهم في أوقات الفلتات على سبيل الخلسة قال الله تعالى أن الذين اتقوا إذا مسهم طائف من الشيطان تذكروا فإذا هم مبصرون وقال مجاهد في معنى قول الله تعالى من شر الوسواس الخناس قال هو منبسط على القلب فإذا ذكر الله تعالى خنس وانقبض وإذا غفل انبسط على قلبه فالتطارد بين ذكر الله تعالى ووسوسة الشيطان كالتطارد بين النور والظلام وبين الليل والنهار ولتضادهما قال الله تعالى استحوذ عليهم الشيطان فأنساهم ذكر الله
Indeed, due to their opposition, Allah the Exalted has said: "Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah [dhikr Allah]." And the whisperings [waswasa] of Satan are not erased from the heart [qalb] except by the remembrance [dhikr] of something other than what he whispers about, for when the remembrance of a thing occurs to the heart, what was in it before is nullified. However, everything other than Allah the Exalted and other than what pertains to Him can also become a field for Satan. And the remembrance of Allah [dhikr Allah] is that which secures its side, and one knows that Satan has no field in it. A thing is not treated except by its opposite, and the opposite of all the whisperings of Satan is the remembrance of Allah [dhikr Allah] through seeking refuge [isti'adha] and declaring freedom from power and strength, and that is the meaning of your saying: "I seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the accursed," and "There is no power nor strength except with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great." And that is not achieved except by the God-conscious [muttaqun] upon whom the remembrance of Allah the Exalted predominates. Satan only circles them in moments of lapses, by way of stealth. Allah the Exalted has said: "Indeed, those who are conscious of Allah—when an impulse from Satan touches them, they remember [dhikr] and then they see clearly." And Mujahid said regarding the meaning of the statement of Allah the Exalted, "From the evil of the retreating whisperer [al-waswas al-khannas]," he said: "He spreads over the heart [qalb], so when Allah the Exalted is remembered [dhikr], he retreats and withdraws, and when one is heedless, he spreads over his heart." So the chasing away between the remembrance of Allah the Exalted [dhikr Allah] and the whispering of Satan is like the chasing away between light [nur] and darkness, and between night and day. And due to their opposition, Allah the Exalted has said: "Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah [dhikr Allah]."

a.g: Indeed, the ones who oppose Allah and His Messenger - those will be among the most humbled.
Allah has written, "I will surely overcome, I and My messengers." Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ومهما قصده عدو أو سبع في ليل أو نهار فليقرأ آية الكرسي وشهد الله وسور الإخلاص والمعوذتين وليقل بسم الله ما شاء الله لا قوة إلا بالله حسبي الله توكلت على الله ما شاء الله لا يأتي بالخيرات إلا الله ما شاء الله لا يصرف السوء إلا الله حسبي الله وكفى سمع الله لمن دعا ليس وراء الله منتهى ولا دون الله ملجأ كتب الله لأغلبن أنا ورسلي إن الله قوي عزيز تحصنت بالله العظيم واستعنت بالحي القيوم الذي لا يموت
Indeed, this is the established practice [sunnah]. And whenever an enemy or a beast intends harm, by night or by day, then let him recite the Verse of the Throne [Ayat al-Kursi] and "God bears witness" [Surah 4:87], and the Surahs of Sincerity [al-Ikhlas] and the Two Refuges [al-Mu'awwidhatayn]. And let him say: In the name of God [Bismillah]. What God wills [ma sha' Allah]. There is no power except with God [la hawla wa la quwwata illa billah]. God is sufficient for me [hasbi Allah]. I have placed my trust in God [tawakkaltu 'ala Allah]. What God wills [ma sha' Allah]. None brings forth good things except God [la ya'ti bi al-khayrat illa Allah]. What God wills [ma sha' Allah]. None averts evil except God [la yasrifu al-su' illa Allah]. God is sufficient for me [hasbi Allah] and He suffices. God hears whoever calls [sami'a Allahu liman da'a]. There is no ultimate end beyond God [laysa wara'a Allah muntaha], and no refuge below God [wa la dun Allah malja']. God has decreed: "I will surely prevail, I and My messengers. Indeed, God is Powerful, Exalted in Might." [Quran 58:21]. I have fortified myself with God, the Almighty [tahassantu bi Allah al-'Azim].

a.g: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him - those are the party of Allah. Unquestionably, the party of Allah - they are the successful.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد قال رسول الله ﷺ "ثلاث مهلكات: شح مطاع وهوى متبع وإعجاب المرء بنفسه" فالكبر والعجب داءان مهلكان، والمتكبر والمعجب سقيمان مريضان، وهما عند الله ممقوتان بغيضان. وإذا كان القصد في هذا الربع من كتاب إحياء علوم الدين شرح المهلكات وجب إيضاح الكبر والعجب فإنهما من قبائح المرديات. ونحن نستقصي بيانهما من الكتاب في شطرين: شطر في الكبر، وشطر في العجب. الشطر الأول من الكتاب: في الكبر، وفيه؛ بيان ذم الكبر، وبيان ذم الاختيال، وبيان فضيلة التواضع، وبيان حقيقة التكبر وآفته، وبيان من يتكبر عليه ودرجات التكبر، وبيان ما به التكبر، وبيان البواعث على التكبر، وبيان أخلاق المتواضعين وما فيه يظهر الكبر، وبيان علاج الكبر. وبيان امتحان النفس في خلق الكبر، وبيان المحمود من خلق التواضع والمذموم منه. بيان ذم الكبر قد ذم الله الكبر في مواضع من كتابه وذم كل جبار متكبر فقال تعالى "سأصرف عن آياتي الذين يتكبرون في الأرض بغير الحق" وقال عز وجل "كذلك يطبع الله على كل قلب متكبر جبار" وقال تعالى "واستفتحوا وخاب كل جبار عنيد" وقال تعالى "إنه لا يحب المستكبرين" وقال تعالى "لقد استكبروا في أنفسهم وعتوا عتواً كبيراً" وقال تعالى "إن الذين يستكبرون عن عبادتي سيدخلون جهنم داخرين" وذم الكبر في القرآن كثير وقد قال رسول الله ﷺ "لا يدخل الجنة من كان في قلبه مثقال حبة من خردل من كبر، ولا يدخل النار من كان في قلبه مثقال حبة من خردل من إيمان" وقال أبو هريرة رضي الله عنه: قال رسول الله ﷺ "يقول الله تعالى الكبرياء ردائي والعظمة إزاري فمن نازعني واحداً منهما ألقيته في جهنم ولا أبالي" وعن أبي سلمة بن عبد الرحمن قال: التقى عبد الله بن عمرو وعبد الله بن عمر على الصفا فتواقفا، فمضى ابن عمرو وأقام ابن عمر يبكي، فقالوا ما يبكيك يا أبا عبد الرحمن؟ فقال: هذا - يعني عبد الله بن عمرو - زعم أنه سمع رسول الله ﷺ يقول "من كان في قلبه مثقال حبة من خردل من كبر أكبه الله في النار على وجهه" وقال رسول الله ﷺ "لا يزال الرجل يذهب بنفسه حتى يكتب في الجبارين فيصيبه ما أصابهم من العذاب" وقال سليمان بن داود عليهما السلام يوماً -للطير والإنس والجن والبهائم: اخرجوا، فخرجوا في مائتي ألف من الإنس ومائتي ألف من الجن، فرفع حتى سمع زجل الملائكة بالتسبيح في السموات، ثم خفض حتى مست أقدامه البحر، فسمع صوتاً: لو كان في قلب صاحبكم مثقال ذرة من كبر لخسفت به أبعد مما رفعته. وقال ﷺ "يخرج من النار عنق له أذنان تسمعان وعينان تبصران ولسان ينطق يقول: وكلت بثلاثة: بكل جبار عنيد وبكل من دعا مع الله إلهاً آخر وبالمصورين" وقال ﷺ "لا يدخل الجنة بخيل ولا جبار ولا سيئ الملكة" وقال ﷺ "تحاجت الجنة والنار فقالت النار: أوثرت بالمتكبرين والمتجبرين، وقالت الجنة: ما لي لا يدخلني إلا ضعفاء الناس وسقاطهم وعجزتهم؟ فقال الله للجنة: إنما أنت رحمتي أرحم بك من أشاء من عبادي، وقال للنار: إنما أنت عذابي أعذب بك من أشاء ولكل واحدة منكما ملؤها" وقال ﷺ "بئس العبد عبد تجبر واعتدى ونسى الجبار الأعلى، بئس العبد عبد تجبر واختال ونسى الكبير المتعال، بئس العبد عبد غفل وسها ونسى المقابر والبلى بئس العبد عبد عتا وبغى ونسى المبدأ والمنتهى" وعن ثابت أنه قال: بلغنا أنه قيل: يا رسول الله ما أعظم كبر فلان! فقال "أليس بعده الموت" وقال عبد الله بن عمرو: إن رسول الله ﷺ
Indeed, the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Three things are destructive: obeyed stinginess, a followed desire [hawa], and a man's admiration of himself." So, arrogance [kibr] and self-admiration [‘ujb] are two destructive diseases, and the arrogant [mutakabbir] and the self-admiring [mu‘jib] are two sick, afflicted ones, and they are, with God, detested and loathed. And since the intent in this quarter of the Book *The Revival of the Religious Sciences* is to explain the destructive things, it is necessary to clarify arrogance [kibr] and self-admiration [‘ujb], for they are among the vile, ruinous things. And we will exhaustively explain them from the Book in two parts: a part on arrogance [kibr], and a part on self-admiration [‘ujb]. **The First Part of the Book: On Arrogance [kibr], and in it:** An explanation of the censure of arrogance [kibr], an explanation of the censure of strutting [ikhtiyal], an explanation of the virtue of humility [tawadu‘], an explanation of the reality of arrogance [takabbur] and its affliction, an explanation of whom one is arrogant [mutakabbir] towards and the degrees of arrogance [takabbur], an explanation of that by which one is arrogant [mutakabbir], an explanation of the incitements to arrogance [takabbur], an explanation of the character traits of the humble [mutawadi‘in] and that in which arrogance [kibr] appears, an explanation of the treatment for arrogance [kibr], an explanation of testing the soul [nafs] in the trait of arrogance [kibr], and an explanation of the praiseworthy from the trait of humility [tawadu‘] and the blameworthy from it. **An Explanation of the Censure of Arrogance [kibr]:** God has censured arrogance [kibr] in places of His Book and censured every tyrant [jabbar], arrogant one [mutakabbir]. So the Exalted said: "I will turn away from My signs those who are arrogant [mutakabbirin] on the earth without right." And the Mighty and Majestic said: "Thus does God seal over every heart [qalb] of an arrogant [mutakabbir] tyrant [jabbar]." And the Exalted said: "And they sought victory, and disappointed was every obstinate tyrant [jabbar ‘anid]." And the Exalted said: "Indeed, He does not love the arrogant [mustakbirin]." And the Exalted said: "They had certainly become arrogant [istakbaru] within themselves and transgressed a great transgression." And the Exalted said: "Indeed, those who are arrogant [yastakbirun] toward My worship will enter Hell [Jahannam] in humiliation." And the censure of arrogance [kibr] in the Qur'an is abundant. And the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "He in whose heart [qalb] is an atom's weight of arrogance [kibr] will not enter Paradise [Jannah], and he in whose heart [qalb] is an atom's weight of faith [iman] will not enter the Fire [Nar]." And Abu Hurayrah, may God be pleased with him, said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "God the Exalted says: 'Grandeur [kibriya’] is My cloak and majesty [‘azamah] is My garment. So whoever contends with Me for one of them, I will cast him into Hell [Jahannam] and I do not care.'" And from Abu Salamah ibn ‘Abd al-Rahman, he said: ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Amr and ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Umar met at al-Safa and stood together. Then Ibn ‘Amr went on, and Ibn ‘Umar remained weeping. They said: "What makes you weep, O Abu ‘Abd al-Rahman?" He said: "This one – meaning ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Amr – claimed that he heard the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'Whoever has in his heart [qalb] an atom's weight of arrogance [kibr], God will cast him on his face into the Fire [Nar].'" And the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man continues to go away with himself until he is written among the tyrants [jabbarin], and then befalls him what befell them of punishment." And Sulayman ibn Dawud, peace be upon them both, said one day – to the birds, mankind, jinn, and beasts: "Come out." So they came out, two hundred thousand from mankind and two hundred thousand from the jinn. Then he was raised until he heard the clamor of the angels glorifying in the heavens, then he was lowered until his feet touched the sea. Then he heard a voice: "If there were in the heart [qalb] of your companion an atom's weight of arrogance [kibr], I would have caused the earth to swallow him to a distance farther than I raised him." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There will emerge from the Fire [Nar] a neck having two ears that hear, two eyes that see, and a tongue that speaks, saying: 'I have been entrusted with three: with every obstinate tyrant [jabbar ‘anid], and with everyone who called upon another god besides God, and with the image-makers.'" And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The stingy one, nor the tyrant [jabbar], nor the one of bad character will enter Paradise [Jannah]." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Paradise [Jannah] and the Fire [Nar] argued. The Fire [Nar] said: 'I have been favored with the arrogant [mutakabbirin] and the tyrants [mutajabbirin].' And Paradise [Jannah] said: 'What is with me that none enter me except the weak of the people, their lowly, and their incapable?' So God said to Paradise [Jannah]: 'You are only My mercy [rahmah]; I show mercy with you to whom I will of My servants.' And He said to the Fire [Nar]: 'You are only My punishment; I punish with you whom I will. And for each one of you is its full measure.'" And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Wretched is the servant [‘abd] who acts tyrannically [tajabbar] and transgresses and forgets the Supreme Tyrant [al-Jabbar al-A‘la]. Wretched is the servant [‘abd] who acts tyrannically [tajabbar] and struts [ikhtiyal] and forgets the Great, the Most High [al-Kabir al-Muta‘al]. Wretched is the servant [‘abd] who is heedless and negligent and forgets the graves and decay. Wretched is the servant [‘abd] who is insolent and oppressive and forgets the Beginning [al-Mabda’] and the End [al-Muntaha]." And from Thabit, he said: It reached us that it was said: "O Messenger of God, how great is the arrogance [kibr] of so-and-so!" So he said: "Is not after him death?" And ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Amr said: Indeed, the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him...
